competitors.name: Microsoft Power BI
competitors.notes: Dominant player with competitive $20/user pricing, extensive Microsoft ecosystem integration, easier setup than Domo

competitors.name: Tableau
competitors.notes: Top alternative with advanced visualization capabilities, though can be expensive for large server deployments

competitors.name: Looker (Google Cloud)
competitors.notes: Cloud-based tool with Looker Studio offering simple interface and minimal learning curve, backed by LookML semantic modeling

competitors.name: ThoughtSpot
competitors.notes: AI-powered search analytics with higher G2 ratings than Domo in self-service category, intuitive UI

competitors.name: Mode
competitors.notes: Strong competitor with intuitive SQL editor for analyzing large datasets and building interactive visualizations

competitors.name: MicroStrategy
competitors.notes: Connects with multiple data sources, enables dashboard building and embedded analytics

competitors.name: Amazon QuickSight
competitors.notes: Fast cloud-powered analytics service for building visualizations and ad-hoc analysis

competitors.name: IBM Cognos Analytics
competitors.notes: Wide range of BI tools for monitoring events, creating reports, and analyzing data

competitors.name: Qlik Sense
competitors.notes: Self-service analytics and data visualization platform, continued evolution in associative engine technology

competitors.name: Sisense
competitors.notes: BI platform for complex data analytics and embedded analytics use cases

competitors.name: Ajelix BI
competitors.notes: Emerging AI-powered BI alternative focused on data analysis

competitors.name: Datapad
competitors.notes: Modern BI alternative with focus on mobile and simplified analytics

context: In 2024, Domo faces intense competition in a mature cloud BI market. Key competitive dynamics include: (1) Price pressure from Power BI's affordable pricing vs Domo's premium model, (2) AI-powered analytics emergence (ThoughtSpot, Ajelix), (3) Simplified/mobile-first solutions (Looker Studio, Datapad), (4) Performance issues with large datasets cited as pain point, (5) Limited customization compared to competitors. Users seek alternatives due to Domo's high pricing for SMBs, scalability cost concerns, and limited visualization capabilities.
